## Converters.mapOf() function

A helper function to create a [Converter](./ts-utils.converter.md) which converts the `string`<!-- -->-keyed properties using a supplied [Converter&lt;T&gt;](./ts-utils.converter.md) to produce a `Map<string, T>` and optionally specified handling of elements that cannot be converted.

**Signature:**

```typescript
export declare function mapOf<T, TC = undefined, TK extends string = string>(converter: Converter<T, TC>, onError: 'fail' | 'ignore'): Converter<Map<TK, T>, TC>;
```

## Parameters

|  Parameter | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  converter | [Converter](./ts-utils.converter.md)<!-- -->&lt;T, TC&gt; | [Converter](./ts-utils.converter.md) used to convert each item in the source object. |
|  onError | 'fail' \| 'ignore' |  |

**Returns:**

[Converter](./ts-utils.converter.md)<!-- -->&lt;Map&lt;TK, T&gt;, TC&gt;

A [Converter](./ts-utils.converter.md) which returns `Map<string, T>`<!-- -->. 

## Remarks

if `onError` is `'fail'` (default), then the entire conversion fails if any key or element cannot be converted. If `onError` is `'ignore'`<!-- -->, failing elements are silently ignored.
